DGACM.relevance_comment: Operative paragraph 6 (“Requests the Chairman of the Committee on Conferences and the Secretary‑General to maintain their contacts … in order to assist those organs in making better use of their services”). This directs the Secretary‑General and the Committee on Conferences to engage with United Nations organs that have under‑utilized conference‑servicing resources so as to assist them to use those services better. The Department for General Assembly and Conference Management (DGACM) provides the Secretariat support to the Committee on Conferences and is the Organization’s conference‑servicing arm (see PPB paras. 2.1(c), 2.2 and subprogrammes on planning/coordination of conference services). DGACM would therefore be the operational entity to prepare and deliver the assistance, outreach and technical support called for by this paragraph (e.g., through planning, consultations, and service adjustments).

Operative paragraph 4 under “Control and Limitation of Documentation” (“Requests the Secretary‑General to establish a standard format for final reports of special conferences … and to provide guidelines for the preparation and editing of those reports”). This is an explicit request to the Secretary‑General to set documentation standards and guidance. DGACM’s PPB identifies its core responsibility for documentation, publishing and editorial standards (see PPB paras. 2.1(a),(c); subprogramme 3 and subprogramme 4 descriptions such as paras. 2.46 and 2.59). DGACM would therefore be the principal Secretariat service responsible for developing and implementing the standard format and editorial guidelines referenced in this paragraph.

Operative paragraph beginning “Requests the Secretary‑General to submit information to the Committee on Conferences at its organizational session … to assist the Committee in establishing its work programme on a biennial basis …” This directs the Secretary‑General to provide information to the Committee on Conferences to assist its planning. DGACM provides substantive and technical secretariat support to the Committee on Conferences and to the organization and calendar of meetings (see PPB paras. 2.1(c), 2.20 and the Committee on Conferences terms noted in the PPB). DGACM would therefore be responsible for preparing and supplying the information the Secretary‑General is requested to submit.

Operative paragraph (“Requests the Secretary‑General to continue his valuable efforts to implement resolution 42/207 C” and to report thereon). Resolution 42/207 C and its follow‑up concern control/limitation of documentation and related Secretariat practices. DGACM’s mandate covers documentation management, publication policies and monitoring implementation of Assembly decisions on conference servicing and documentation (see PPB paras. 2.1, 2.14 and subprogramme 3 activities). While the paragraph addresses the Secretary‑General, DGACM would be the primary Secretariat unit responsible for carrying out the implementation measures and for supplying the reporting requested of the Secretary‑General.
